intro: Ridleyandra nuangensis, commonly known as the Nuangensis Ridleyandra, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
